alert.note: Alert for Eastern Orleans; Lower St. Bernard; Northern St. Tammany; Southeast St. Tammany; Southwestern St. Tammany; Upper St. Bernard; Western Orleans (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Dense Fog Advisory issued February 22 at 3:24PM CST until February 23 at 10:00AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 10 AM CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Advisory, south winds 20 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. For the Dense Fog Advisory, visibility one quarter mile or less in dense fog. * WHERE...In Louisiana, Upper St. Bernard, Lower St. Bernard, Southeast St. Tammany, Western Orleans, Eastern Orleans, Northern St. Tammany and Southwestern St. Tammany Parishes. In Mississippi, Hancock, Harrison and Jackson Counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, until 6 PM CST this evening. For the Dense Fog Advisory, from midnight tonight to 10 AM CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Dense fog impacts will be seen closest to the immediate coast.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. If driving, slow down, use your low beam headlights, and leave plenty of distance ahead of you.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Orleans; Lower St. Bernard; Northern St. Tammany; Southeast St. Tammany; Southwestern St. Tammany; Upper St. Bernard; Western Orleans
